article.headline: Wofford 83, W. Carolina 73
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. (AP) -- Junior Salters scored a career-high 26 points to lead Wofford past Western Carolina 83-73 on Saturday night. Tim Johnson had 17 points, Drew Gibson added 14 points and Matt Estep finished with 13 for the Terriers (11-8, 4-5 Southern Conference), who shot 71 percent in the second half and 60 percent overall in winning their third straight since losing three in a row. Salters, who was 8 of 12 shooting, surpassed his previous high of 20 set last season at Clemson. Brandon Giles scored 24 points -- his second straight 20-point game -- for Western Carolina (6-13, 2-7). Negus McKenna added 19 points and Arnold Gore finished with 10 for the Catamounts, who shot 57 percent in the first half, led 43-36 at halftime but made just 34.5 percent of its attempts after the break. Western Carolina was denied its first consecutive victories of the season and its first road victory in 2007-08.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
